item.title: An analytical solution to cos^2(theta) over a spherical surface
item.description: In his book 3 in the fantastic series Raytracing in a weekend Peter Shirley computes an integral numerically and leaves the analytical solution as an exercise. This analytical proof is presented below. Putting everything down formally, this is what we’re tryign to compute: $$ \iint_{\Omega} f dS $$ The integrand is a function in spherical coordinates, that is \(f(r, \theta, \phi) = \cos^2(\theta) \). Domain of integration is denoted by \(\Omega\)

item.title: A trip down the transformation pipeline in Mapbox GL-JS
item.description: In this article I will briefly explain how GL-JS renders an encoded point from a vector tile onto the screen. Few notes I assume you already know what vector tiles are so here are few things to know about Mapbox vector tiles: They are agnostic of geographics information. Mapbox vector tiles have a resolution of 512 pixels. They are efficiently encoded (using google protobufs) for fast transfer over web. Let’s go!
